trans-unit.source: Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge
trans-unit.target: Create an XML Request-Reply Bridge

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps create an <token>request_response</token> in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps create an <token>request_response</token> in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: <token>xml_bridge</token>s have different stages.
trans-unit.target: <token>xml_bridge</token>s have different stages.

trans-unit.source: In this topic:
trans-unit.target: In this topic:

trans-unit.source: Add the Bridge to the BizTalk Services project
trans-unit.target: Add the Bridge to the BizTalk Services project

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link> lists the steps.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link> lists the steps.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel>, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel>, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>request_response</token></embeddedLabel> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel><token>request_response</token></embeddedLabel> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: A <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file is added to the solution.
trans-unit.target: A <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file is added to the solution.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <token>bridge</token>, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and then enter the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <token>bridge</token>, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and then enter the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Associated Project Item
trans-unit.target: Associated Project Item

trans-unit.source: Read-only: The name of the associated .BridgeConfig file.
trans-unit.target: Read-only: The name of the associated .BridgeConfig file.

trans-unit.source: To change the name of the file, change the <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To change the name of the file, change the <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: The name of the <token>xml_bridge</token> on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: The name of the <token>xml_bridge</token> on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: This name should be unique for the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This name should be unique for the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: The name of the <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file is the same as the value you enter here.
trans-unit.target: The name of the <legacyItalic>.BridgeConfig</legacyItalic> file is the same as the value you enter here.

trans-unit.source: Relative Address
trans-unit.target: Relative Address

trans-unit.source: The relative address where the <token>xml_bridge</token> is hosted on <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: The relative address where the <token>xml_bridge</token> is hosted on <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: This address combined with the <token>af_integration</token> URL you enter in Step 2 creates the complete URL for the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: This address combined with the <token>af_integration</token> URL you enter in Step 2 creates the complete URL for the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the <token>af_integration</token> URL is <embeddedLabel>MyBizTalkService</embeddedLabel> and the relative address of the <token>bridge</token> is <embeddedLabel>UpdateCustomers</embeddedLabel>, the URL for the endpoint on the <token>sb2</token> is <legacyItalic>https://MyBizTalkService.biztalk.windows.net/default/UpdateCustomers</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the <token>af_integration</token> URL is <embeddedLabel>MyBizTalkService</embeddedLabel> and the relative address of the <token>bridge</token> is <embeddedLabel>UpdateCustomers</embeddedLabel>, the URL for the endpoint on the <token>sb2</token> is <legacyItalic>https://MyBizTalkService.biztalk.windows.net/default/UpdateCustomers</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Route Ordering Table
trans-unit.target: Route Ordering Table

trans-unit.source: Enter the routing order of the message from the <token>bridge</token> to other components of the message flow.
trans-unit.target: Enter the routing order of the message from the <token>bridge</token> to other components of the message flow.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0#BKMK_Order" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">The Routing Order</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0#BKMK_Order" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">The Routing Order</link>.

trans-unit.source: Runtime Address
trans-unit.target: Runtime Address

trans-unit.source: The public runtime endpoint URL where the bridge is deployed.
trans-unit.target: The public runtime endpoint URL where the bridge is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Track Properties
trans-unit.target: Track Properties

trans-unit.source: Set this property to define which message properties are tracked by the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to define which message properties are tracked by the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="04a41fee-5705-43d1-8ee3-2b78e130a3ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages Processed by the Bridge</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="04a41fee-5705-43d1-8ee3-2b78e130a3ac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Tracking Messages Processed by the Bridge</link>.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the request schemas
trans-unit.target: Enter the request schemas

trans-unit.source: A single <token>msgflow_proj</token> can have multiple bridges and multiple schemas.
trans-unit.target: A single <token>msgflow_proj</token> can have multiple bridges and multiple schemas.

trans-unit.source: For ease of use and to save on processing time, you can associate schemas with bridges.
trans-unit.target: For ease of use and to save on processing time, you can associate schemas with bridges.

trans-unit.source: In other words, you can require that a specific bridge can only process messages that conform to a specific schema or a set of schemas.
trans-unit.target: In other words, you can require that a specific bridge can only process messages that conform to a specific schema or a set of schemas.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps to create this association.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps to create this association.

trans-unit.source: Add the schemas to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Add the schemas to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create a BizTalk Service Project</link> lists the steps.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create a BizTalk Service Project</link> lists the steps.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step to add any number of schemas that you need for your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step to add any number of schemas that you need for your <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: The itinerary designer is a read-only area.
trans-unit.target: The itinerary designer is a read-only area.

trans-unit.source: You cannot add or remove a stage or an activity from the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: You cannot add or remove a stage or an activity from the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: On the <token>bridge</token> design area in the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>bridge</token> design area in the <embeddedLabel>Message Types</embeddedLabel> box, select the add icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="fce8ff96-426e-468b-8afd-25eb4c847028" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to open <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>:
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>:

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the schema for the Request message.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Available message types</embeddedLabel> box, select the schema for the Request message.

trans-unit.source: Select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to associate the Request schema with the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to associate the Request schema with the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] under <embeddedLabel>Response Message Type</embeddedLabel> to associate the Response schema with the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Select the right arrow icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="a08ed386-6bf6-4164-9052-5f05154d8eff" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] under <embeddedLabel>Response Message Type</embeddedLabel> to associate the Response schema with the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The schema that you selected is now listed under the <embeddedLabel>Message Type</embeddedLabel> box.
trans-unit.target: The schema that you selected is now listed under the <embeddedLabel>Message Type</embeddedLabel> box.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: You cannot add multiple schemas at the same time.
trans-unit.target: You cannot add multiple schemas at the same time.

trans-unit.source: To associate more schemas with the <token>bridge</token>, repeat this step.
trans-unit.target: To associate more schemas with the <token>bridge</token>, repeat this step.

trans-unit.source: To remove a schema association with the <token>bridge</token>, select the schema from the <embeddedLabel>Message Type</embeddedLabel> box, and then press the delete icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="720e9261-6c87-45e3-9a96-f72269668c3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ].
trans-unit.target: To remove a schema association with the <token>bridge</token>, select the schema from the <embeddedLabel>Message Type</embeddedLabel> box, and then press the delete icon [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="720e9261-6c87-45e3-9a96-f72269668c3a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ].

trans-unit.source: To replace one schema association with another, click the edit button [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="5cf4298b-deeb-4cd0-a905-ee7412ee735f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to reopen <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To replace one schema association with another, click the edit button [ <mediaLinkInline><image xlink:href="5cf4298b-deeb-4cd0-a905-ee7412ee735f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"></image></mediaLinkInline> ] to reopen <embeddedLabel>Message Type Picker</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Validate stage for the Request message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Validate stage for the Request message

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage, you can enter whether the stage does any schema validation on the incoming request message and whether the validation warnings can be propagated back to the client as exceptions.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage, you can enter whether the stage does any schema validation on the incoming request message and whether the validation warnings can be propagated back to the client as exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>bridge</token> to open the <token>msgflow</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>bridge</token> to open the <token>msgflow</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel>, the stage validates the incoming request message against the schemas you previously added.
trans-unit.target: When <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel>, the stage validates the incoming request message against the schemas you previously added.

trans-unit.source: If <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>, there is no schema validation and the message is simply passed through to the next stage.
trans-unit.target: If <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>, there is no schema validation and the message is simply passed through to the next stage.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>before</legacyItalic> the message enters the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>before</legacyItalic> the message enters the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> the message exits the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> the message exits the <embeddedLabel>Validate</embeddedLabel> stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Validate</embeddedLabel> activity.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Validate</embeddedLabel> activity.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>Report Warnings As Errors</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>Report Warnings As Errors</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel>, the <token>bridge</token> reports any warnings as errors encountered during XML validation against a schema and returns them back to the client that sent the request message.
trans-unit.target: When <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel>, the <token>bridge</token> reports any warnings as errors encountered during XML validation against a schema and returns them back to the client that sent the request message.

trans-unit.source: A validation warning is thrown as an exception and the validation fails.
trans-unit.target: A validation warning is thrown as an exception and the validation fails.

trans-unit.source: See <externalLink><linkText>Validation and the Schema Object Model</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa310912(v=VS.71).aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to understand the warnings and errors in XML schema validation.
trans-unit.target: See <externalLink><linkText>Validation and the Schema Object Model</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/aa310912(v=VS.71).aspx</linkUri></externalLink> to understand the warnings and errors in XML schema validation.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Enrich Stage (and its Properties) for the Request message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Enrich Stage (and its Properties) for the Request message

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage enables message enrichment by defining properties, the values for which can be derived from the message header (standard or custom), through default properties promoted by <token>af_integration</token>, from an external data source (only <token>ssSDSfull</token> tables are supported), or from an element within the message body.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage enables message enrichment by defining properties, the values for which can be derived from the message header (standard or custom), through default properties promoted by <token>af_integration</token>, from an external data source (only <token>ssSDSfull</token> tables are supported), or from an element within the message body.

trans-unit.source: These properties can then be used to either route the message to a destination endpoint or for further processing by the message receiving entity.
trans-unit.target: These properties can then be used to either route the message to a destination endpoint or for further processing by the message receiving entity.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps for performing each of the following actions:
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps for performing each of the following actions:

trans-unit.source: Assign message header values to properties.
trans-unit.target: Assign message header values to properties.

trans-unit.source: Use default properties or system properties promoted by <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: Use default properties or system properties promoted by <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Look up an external data source
trans-unit.target: Look up an external data source

trans-unit.source: Extract values from a message body element using Xpath
trans-unit.target: Extract values from a message body element using Xpath

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Important</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Important</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: The property names you enter in this stage are not case-sensitive.
trans-unit.target: The property names you enter in this stage are not case-sensitive.

trans-unit.source: The property you enter in this stage is not for Route or Reply Actions <legacyItalic>unless</legacyItalic> you save the <token>msgflow</token>.
trans-unit.target: The property you enter in this stage is not for Route or Reply Actions <legacyItalic>unless</legacyItalic> you save the <token>msgflow</token>.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="2b28ccb0-dd88-4fbc-a5c4-c3b797a901e8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Route and Send Actions: Bridging Protocol Mismatch</link> for more details on Route and Reply.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="2b28ccb0-dd88-4fbc-a5c4-c3b797a901e8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Route and Send Actions: Bridging Protocol Mismatch</link> for more details on Route and Reply.

trans-unit.source: You can choose whether you want to perform any of these actions by turning the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage on or off.
trans-unit.target: You can choose whether you want to perform any of these actions by turning the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage on or off.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Steps</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Steps</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> and there is no property defined, then the <token>bridge</token> does not throw an error when configuring the <token>bridge</token> (design-time) nor when processing the message (run-time).
trans-unit.target: When <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> and there is no property defined, then the <token>bridge</token> does not throw an error when configuring the <token>bridge</token> (design-time) nor when processing the message (run-time).

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>before</legacyItalic> the message enters this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>before</legacyItalic> the message enters this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> the message exits this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> the message exits this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity.
trans-unit.target: Within the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> activity.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> property to open <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Property Definition</embeddedLabel> property to open <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Property Definitions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel>, you can use values from various sources and include them in the message as properties.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add Property</embeddedLabel>, you can use values from various sources and include them in the message as properties.

trans-unit.source: These properties and their values can then be used later for other processing tasks, like routing messages to different destinations based on property values (see <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0#BKMK_RoutingAction" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">The Routing Action</link>).
trans-unit.target: These properties and their values can then be used later for other processing tasks, like routing messages to different destinations based on property values (see <link xlink:href="498de1a4-3427-4314-a152-8d5a7f026cc0#BKMK_RoutingAction" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">The Routing Action</link>).

trans-unit.source: The following table lists the different sources and ways to add properties to the message:
trans-unit.target: The following table lists the different sources and ways to add properties to the message:

trans-unit.target: Source

trans-unit.target: How To

trans-unit.source: Assign message header values to properties
trans-unit.target: Assign message header values to properties

trans-unit.source: Use system-promoted properties
trans-unit.target: Use system-promoted properties

trans-unit.source: This is how the logic flows (explained using the same purchase order example as above):
trans-unit.target: This is how the logic flows (explained using the same purchase order example as above):

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> looks up the value of P1 (<embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel>) in the input query column (<embeddedLabel>P_Order</embeddedLabel>) in the table (<embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>) defined in the <embeddedLabel>MyProvider</embeddedLabel> provider configuration.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> looks up the value of P1 (<embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel>) in the input query column (<embeddedLabel>P_Order</embeddedLabel>) in the table (<embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>) defined in the <embeddedLabel>MyProvider</embeddedLabel> provider configuration.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> then picks up the value corresponding to <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> from the output query column (<embeddedLabel>Cust_Name</embeddedLabel>) in the <embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> then picks up the value corresponding to <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> from the output query column (<embeddedLabel>Cust_Name</embeddedLabel>) in the <embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The value picked up from the output query column is assigned to the property P2.
trans-unit.target: The value picked up from the output query column is assigned to the property P2.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the customer name corresponding to purchase order <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> is <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel>, the value of P2 is set to John.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the customer name corresponding to purchase order <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> is <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel>, the value of P2 is set to John.

trans-unit.source: The data type of property P2 is set to <embeddedLabel>string</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The data type of property P2 is set to <embeddedLabel>string</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.target: To update or remove a property definition, you can select the property definition in the dialog box and then click <embeddedLabel>Edit</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>Remove</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: How do the Properties get Promoted?
trans-unit.target: How do the Properties get Promoted?

trans-unit.source: At design-time using the <token>msgflow</token> design surface, you can define the properties that will be promoted and the values that will get assigned to them.
trans-unit.target: At design-time using the <token>msgflow</token> design surface, you can define the properties that will be promoted and the values that will get assigned to them.

trans-unit.source: But the property promotion and value assignment actually happens at runtime; which is when a message flows through the <token>bridge</token> deployed on <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: But the property promotion and value assignment actually happens at runtime; which is when a message flows through the <token>bridge</token> deployed on <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: However, at runtime there could be instances when the property promotion fails due to various reasons.
trans-unit.target: However, at runtime there could be instances when the property promotion fails due to various reasons.

trans-unit.source: Use the following table to understand how and when that can occur:
trans-unit.target: Use the following table to understand how and when that can occur:

trans-unit.source: If this happens
trans-unit.target: If this happens

trans-unit.source: What gets promoted
trans-unit.target: What gets promoted

trans-unit.source: The SOAP or HTTP header you specify during design time does not exist in the actual message that is sent to the <token>bridge</token> at runtime
trans-unit.target: The SOAP or HTTP header you specify during design time does not exist in the actual message that is sent to the <token>bridge</token> at runtime

trans-unit.source: The property you defined at design time does not get promoted at run time; no exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: The property you defined at design time does not get promoted at run time; no exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: The XPATH query you specify during design time does not correspond to an element in the message that is sent to the <token>bridge</token> at runtime
trans-unit.target: The XPATH query you specify during design time does not correspond to an element in the message that is sent to the <token>bridge</token> at runtime

trans-unit.source: The property you defined at design time does not get promoted at run time; no exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: The property you defined at design time does not get promoted at run time; no exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: For Lookup, if the Lookup property you specify at design time, does not exist at runtime (because it never got promoted)
trans-unit.target: For Lookup, if the Lookup property you specify at design time, does not exist at runtime (because it never got promoted)

trans-unit.source: The property that would have been assigned a value as a result of the lookup does not get promoted; no exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: The property that would have been assigned a value as a result of the lookup does not get promoted; no exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: For Lookup, if the provider configuration you specify (which includes the connection string, table name, etc.)
trans-unit.target: For Lookup, if the provider configuration you specify (which includes the connection string, table name, etc.)

trans-unit.source: at design time is incorrect
trans-unit.target: at design time is incorrect

trans-unit.source: At runtime, an exception is thrown; no property gets promoted.
trans-unit.target: At runtime, an exception is thrown; no property gets promoted.

trans-unit.source: No exception is thrown at design time because the <token>msgflow</token> design surface does not do a validation of the provider configuration.
trans-unit.target: No exception is thrown at design time because the <token>msgflow</token> design surface does not do a validation of the provider configuration.

trans-unit.source: Only the user credentials are validated at design-time and if the validation is not successful, deployment fails.
trans-unit.target: Only the user credentials are validated at design-time and if the validation is not successful, deployment fails.

trans-unit.source: For Lookup, if the value of the Lookup property you specify at design time has no match in the provider data source (<token>ssSDSfull</token> table, in this case) at runtime
trans-unit.target: For Lookup, if the value of the Lookup property you specify at design time has no match in the provider data source (<token>ssSDSfull</token> table, in this case) at runtime

trans-unit.source: An exception is thrown; no value gets promoted
trans-unit.target: An exception is thrown; no value gets promoted

trans-unit.source: For Lookup, if the value of the Lookup property you specify at design time has more than one match in the provider data source (<token>ssSDSfull</token> table, in this case) at runtime
trans-unit.target: For Lookup, if the value of the Lookup property you specify at design time has more than one match in the provider data source (<token>ssSDSfull</token> table, in this case) at runtime

trans-unit.source: The property is promoted and only one of the matching values from the data source is assigned as a value to the promoted property.
trans-unit.target: The property is promoted and only one of the matching values from the data source is assigned as a value to the promoted property.

trans-unit.source: For SOAP, HTTP, XPATH, and Lookup, if the data type specified for the property at design time is different from the data type of the value that the property will have at runtime
trans-unit.target: For SOAP, HTTP, XPATH, and Lookup, if the data type specified for the property at design time is different from the data type of the value that the property will have at runtime

trans-unit.source: Wherever the type conversion is possible, the type is converted and the property is promoted.
trans-unit.target: Wherever the type conversion is possible, the type is converted and the property is promoted.

trans-unit.source: For example, at design time you define a property as string but the value assigned to that property at runtime is 30, then the value of that property will be 30 (as a string.)
trans-unit.target: For example, at design time you define a property as string but the value assigned to that property at runtime is 30, then the value of that property will be 30 (as a string.)

trans-unit.source: When type conversion is not possible, an exception is thrown, and the property does not get promoted.
trans-unit.target: When type conversion is not possible, an exception is thrown, and the property does not get promoted.

trans-unit.source: For example, at design time you define a property as double but the value assigned to that property at runtime is John.
trans-unit.target: For example, at design time you define a property as double but the value assigned to that property at runtime is John.

trans-unit.source: Because John cannot be stored in the property as a double, an exception is thrown and the property does not get promoted.
trans-unit.target: Because John cannot be stored in the property as a double, an exception is thrown and the property does not get promoted.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Transform stage for the Request message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Transform stage for the Request message

trans-unit.source: In this stage, you can enter the transforms to be used by the bridge.
trans-unit.target: In this stage, you can enter the transforms to be used by the bridge.

trans-unit.source: You can also enable or disable the stage.
trans-unit.target: You can also enable or disable the stage.

trans-unit.source: Add the transforms to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Add the transforms to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create a BizTalk Service Project</link> lists the steps.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create a BizTalk Service Project</link> lists the steps.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step to add any number of transforms that you need for your project.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step to add any number of transforms that you need for your project.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: If <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel>, the stage uses the transforms that you enter for transforming an incoming request message.
trans-unit.target: If <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel>, the stage uses the transforms that you enter for transforming an incoming request message.

trans-unit.source: If <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>, there is no message transformation and the message is simply passed through to the next stage.
trans-unit.target: If <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel>, there is no message transformation and the message is simply passed through to the next stage.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Additional</legacyBold>:

trans-unit.source: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>before</legacyItalic> the message enters this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>before</legacyItalic> the message enters this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> the message exits this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: To include any custom code that executes <legacyItalic>after</legacyItalic> the message exits this stage, set the <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: Within the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity.
trans-unit.target: Within the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage, select the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property to open <embeddedLabel>Map Selection</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Maps</embeddedLabel> property to open <embeddedLabel>Map Selection</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: From the list of maps displayed, select the maps that you want to associate with the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the list of maps displayed, select the maps that you want to associate with the <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage, and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The maps you added are now listed under <embeddedLabel>Selected Maps</embeddedLabel> on the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: The maps you added are now listed under <embeddedLabel>Selected Maps</embeddedLabel> on the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: The dialog box only displays those maps for which the source schema (of the map) matches the request message schema you entered in <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_AddSchemas" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enter the request schemas</link> (in this topic).
trans-unit.target: The dialog box only displays those maps for which the source schema (of the map) matches the request message schema you entered in <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_AddSchemas" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enter the request schemas</link> (in this topic).

trans-unit.source: If the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property is set to True on the Transform stage and you do not specify a map as part of the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity, the <token>bridge</token> does not thrown an error; neither while configuring the bridge (design-time) nor while processing the message (run-time).
trans-unit.target: If the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property is set to True on the Transform stage and you do not specify a map as part of the <embeddedLabel>Xml Transform</embeddedLabel> activity, the <token>bridge</token> does not thrown an error; neither while configuring the bridge (design-time) nor while processing the message (run-time).

trans-unit.source: You can add or remove a map by clicking the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Map</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: You can add or remove a map by clicking the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Map</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Enrich Stage (post- Transform) for the Request message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Enrich Stage (post- Transform) for the Request message

trans-unit.source: Configuring the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage after a transform stage is identical to configuring an Enrich stage before a transform stage.
trans-unit.target: Configuring the <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage after a transform stage is identical to configuring an Enrich stage before a transform stage.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure the Enrich Stage (and its Properties) for the Request message</link> (in this topic).
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure the Enrich Stage (and its Properties) for the Request message</link> (in this topic).

trans-unit.source: The only thing to consider while configuring a post-transform Enrich stage is that the properties you defined in the pre-transform Enrich stage are also available in the post-transform Enrich stage.
trans-unit.target: The only thing to consider while configuring a post-transform Enrich stage is that the properties you defined in the pre-transform Enrich stage are also available in the post-transform Enrich stage.

trans-unit.source: So, if you want to preserve those properties, do not create properties with the same name.
trans-unit.target: So, if you want to preserve those properties, do not create properties with the same name.

trans-unit.source: If you do, the new property definition overwrites the old property definition.
trans-unit.target: If you do, the new property definition overwrites the old property definition.

trans-unit.source: The post-transform <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage also provides two properties: <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The post-transform <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage also provides two properties: <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: These properties are used to include custom code as part of the bridge processing.
trans-unit.target: These properties are used to include custom code as part of the bridge processing.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Enrich Stage for the Response Message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Enrich Stage for the Response Message

trans-unit.source: The Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is used to promote properties on the response message that is received from the message receiver and has to be sent back to the message sender.
trans-unit.target: The Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is used to promote properties on the response message that is received from the message receiver and has to be sent back to the message sender.

trans-unit.source: The procedure for configuring an Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is identical to configuring an Enrich stage for the request message.
trans-unit.target: The procedure for configuring an Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is identical to configuring an Enrich stage for the request message.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure the Enrich Stage (and its Properties) for the Request message</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure the Enrich Stage (and its Properties) for the Request message</link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that the properties you promoted in all the previous Enrich stages within an <token>request_response</token> are available as part of this Enrich stage.
trans-unit.target: Note that the properties you promoted in all the previous Enrich stages within an <token>request_response</token> are available as part of this Enrich stage.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage for the response message also provides two properties: <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Enrich</embeddedLabel> stage for the response message also provides two properties: <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: These properties are used to include custom code as part of the bridge processing.
trans-unit.target: These properties are used to include custom code as part of the bridge processing.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="8a486c54-dbe7-4c74-9f5a-ffb79b3f950c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Include Custom Code in Bridges</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Transform Stage for the Response Message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Transform Stage for the Response Message

trans-unit.source: The Transform stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is used to transform the response message that is received from the message receiver to a format that conforms to the schema of the message sender.
trans-unit.target: The Transform stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is used to transform the response message that is received from the message receiver to a format that conforms to the schema of the message sender.

trans-unit.source: The procedure for configuring a Transform stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is identical to configuring a Transform stage in a request message.
trans-unit.target: The procedure for configuring a Transform stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is identical to configuring a Transform stage in a request message.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_Transform" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configure the Transform stage for the Request message</link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that only those maps are available for selection whose destination schema (of the map) matches the response message schema you specified in <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_AddSchemas" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enter the request schemas</link> (in this topic).
trans-unit.target: Note that only those maps are available for selection whose destination schema (of the map) matches the response message schema you specified in <link xlink:href="7e5fedb4-9ab1-4470-aa8a-204633391da7#BKMK_TwoWay_AddSchemas" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Enter the request schemas</link> (in this topic).

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage for the response message also provides two properties: <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Transform</embeddedLabel> stage for the response message also provides two properties: <embeddedLabel>On Enter Inspector</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>On Exit Inspector</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Enrich Stage (post-Transform) for the Response Message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Enrich Stage (post-Transform) for the Response Message

trans-unit.source: The post-transform Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is used to promote properties on the transformed response message that is received from the message receiver and has to be sent back to the message sender.
trans-unit.target: The post-transform Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is used to promote properties on the transformed response message that is received from the message receiver and has to be sent back to the message sender.

trans-unit.source: The procedure for configuring a post-transform Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is identical to configuring an Enrich stage in request message.
trans-unit.target: The procedure for configuring a post-transform Enrich stage in the response path of an <token>request_response</token> is identical to configuring an Enrich stage in request message.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Reply Action Before Routing the Response Message
trans-unit.target: Configure the Reply Action Before Routing the Response Message

trans-unit.source: While <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> is technically not a stage in an <token>request_response</token>, it plays a key role in ensuring that any protocol mismatches between the message sender and message receiver are bridged right before the response message is finally sent back to the message sender.
trans-unit.target: While <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> is technically not a stage in an <token>request_response</token>, it plays a key role in ensuring that any protocol mismatches between the message sender and message receiver are bridged right before the response message is finally sent back to the message sender.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="2b28ccb0-dd88-4fbc-a5c4-c3b797a901e8#BKMK_Send" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reply Action</link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="2b28ccb0-dd88-4fbc-a5c4-c3b797a901e8#BKMK_Send" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Reply Action</link>.

trans-unit.source: This section lists the steps on how to configure a Reply Action.
trans-unit.target: This section lists the steps on how to configure a Reply Action.

trans-unit.source: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.
trans-unit.target: Double-click the <token>request_response</token> to open the itinerary designer.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Send Reply</embeddedLabel> box.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Send Reply</embeddedLabel> box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel> to determine whether you want to configure a reply action before sending the response message back to the message sender.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, set the <embeddedLabel>IsEnabled</embeddedLabel> property to <embeddedLabel>True</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>False</embeddedLabel> to determine whether you want to configure a reply action before sending the response message back to the message sender.

trans-unit.source: Click the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel>Send Reply</embeddedLabel> box.
trans-unit.target: Click the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> activity within the <embeddedLabel>Send Reply</embeddedLabel> box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, select the ellipsis button <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Reply Action</embeddedLabel> property to open the <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Reply Actions</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel>, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Add Reply Action</embeddedLabel>, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Property (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Property (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Lists all the properties that have been defined in all the previous four Enrich stages in the <token>request_response</token>.
trans-unit.target: Lists all the properties that have been defined in all the previous four Enrich stages in the <token>request_response</token>.

trans-unit.source: When you select a property, you specify that the value of the selected properties be assigned to the relevant message header of the outgoing response message.
trans-unit.target: When you select a property, you specify that the value of the selected properties be assigned to the relevant message header of the outgoing response message.

trans-unit.source: Expression
trans-unit.target: Expression

trans-unit.source: Use this option to provide an expression, the resultant value of which is passed on to the relevant message header of the outgoing response message.
trans-unit.target: Use this option to provide an expression, the resultant value of which is passed on to the relevant message header of the outgoing response message.

trans-unit.source: You can also use this option to specify a constant value that is assigned to a message header.
trans-unit.target: You can also use this option to specify a constant value that is assigned to a message header.

trans-unit.source: Some example expressions are:
trans-unit.target: Some example expressions are:

trans-unit.source: P1 + P2, where P1 and P2 are two properties that are already defined in any of the four previous Enrich stages
trans-unit.target: P1 + P2, where P1 and P2 are two properties that are already defined in any of the four previous Enrich stages

trans-unit.source: 'Fabrikam', is a string constant
trans-unit.target: 'Fabrikam', is a string constant

trans-unit.source: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: You must always specify the value for an expression within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: You can either choose the <embeddedLabel>Property Name</embeddedLabel> option or the <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> option.
trans-unit.target: You can either choose the <embeddedLabel>Property Name</embeddedLabel> option or the <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> option.

trans-unit.source: These options are mutually exclusive.
trans-unit.target: These options are mutually exclusive.

trans-unit.source: Destination (Write To)
